intro: Asphodeline isthmocarpa, commonly known as the Isthmocarpa asphodel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and tall, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring or early summer. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Asphodeline isthmocarpa is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
